data.title: This Day in History
data.text: Date Description Type 2nd of July 0626 EVENT Li Shimin, the future Emperor Taizong of Tang, Emperor of China, ambushes and kills his rival brothers Li Yuanji and Li Jiancheng in the Incident at Xuanwu Gate. 2nd of July 0706 EVENT In China, Emperor Zhongzong of Tang inters the bodies of relatives in the Qianling Mausoleum, located on Mount Liang outside Chang'an. 2nd of July 0963 EVENT The imperial army proclaims Nicephorus Phocas Emperor of the Romans on the plains outside Cappadocian Caesarea. 2nd of July 1298 EVENT The Battle of Gollheim is fought between Albert I of Habsburg and Adolf of Nassau-Weilburg. 2nd of July 1494 EVENT The Treaty of Tordesillas is ratified by Spain. 2nd of July 1555 EVENT The Ottoman Admiral Turgut Reis sacks the Italian city of Paola. 2nd of July 1561 EVENT Menas, Emperor of Ethiopia, defeats a revolt in Emfraz. 2nd of July 1582 EVENT Battle of Yamazaki: Toyotomi Hideyoshi defeats Akechi Mitsuhide. 2nd of July 1613 EVENT The first English expedition from Massachusetts against Acadia led by Samuel Argall takes place. 2nd of July 1644 EVENT English Civil War: Battle of Marston Moor. 2nd of July 1679 EVENT Europeans first visit Minnesota and see headwaters of Mississippi in an expedition led by Daniel Greysolon de Du Luth. 2nd of July 1698 EVENT Thomas Savery patents the first steam engine. 2nd of July 1776 EVENT The Continental Congress adopts a resolution severing ties with Great Britain although the wording of the formal Declaration of Independence is not approved until July 4. 2nd of July 1777 EVENT Vermont becomes the first American territory to abolish slavery. 2nd of July 1823 EVENT Bahia Independence Day: the end of Portuguese rule in Brazil, with the final defeat of the Portuguese crown loyalists in the province of Bahia. 2nd of July 1839 EVENT Twenty miles off the coast of Cuba, 53 rebelling African slaves led by Joseph Cinque take over the slave ship Amistad. 2nd of July 1853 EVENT The Russian Army crossed the Pruth river into the Danubian Principalities, Moldavia and Wallachia--providing the spark that set off the Crimean War. 2nd of July 1871 EVENT Victor Emmanuel II of Italy enters Rome after having conquered it from the Papal States. 2nd of July 1881 EVENT Charles J. Guiteau shoots and fatally wounds U.S. President James Garfield, who eventually dies from an infection on September 19. 2nd of July 1890 EVENT The U.S. Congress passes the Sherman Anti-Trust Act. 2nd of July 1897 EVENT Italian scientist Guglielmo Marconi obtains a patent for radio in London. 2nd of July 1900 EVENT The first Zeppelin flight takes place on Lake Constance near Friedrichshafen, Germany. 2nd of July 1917 EVENT The East St. Louis Riots end. 2nd of July 1934 EVENT The Night of the Long Knives ends with the death of Ernst Rohm. 2nd of July 1937 EVENT Amelia Earhart and navigator Fred Noonan are last heard from over the Pacific Ocean while attempting to make the first equatorial round-the-world flight. 2nd of July 1940 EVENT Indian independence leader Subhas Chandra Bose is arrested and detained in Calcutta. 2nd of July 1950 EVENT The Golden Pavilion at Kinkaku-ji in Kyoto, Japan burns down. 2nd of July 1962 EVENT The first Wal-Mart store opens for business in Rogers, Arkansas. 2nd of July 1964 EVENT U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson signs the Civil Rights Act of 1964 meant to prohibit segregation in public places. 2nd of July 1966 EVENT The French military explodes a nuclear test bomb codenamed Aldebaran in Mururoa, their first nuclear test in the Pacific. 2nd of July 1976 EVENT Fall of the Republic of Vietnam; Communist North Vietnam declares their union to form the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 2nd of July 1993 EVENT 37 participants in an Alevi cultural and literary festival are killed when a mob of demonstrators set fire to their hotel in Sivas during a violent protest. 2nd of July 2000 EVENT Vicente Fox Quesada is elected the first President of Mexico from an opposition party, the Partido Accion Nacional, after more than 70 years of continuous rule by the Partido Revolucionario Institucional. 2nd of July 2001 EVENT The AbioCor self contained artificial heart is first implanted. 2nd of July 2002 EVENT Steve Fossett becomes the first person to fly solo around the world nonstop in a balloon. 2nd of July 2003 EVENT Silvio Berlusconi, Prime Minister of Italy, insults German MP Martin Schulz by calling him a "kapo" during a session of the European Parliament. 2nd of July 2004 EVENT ASEAN Regional Forum accepts Pakistan as its 24th member. 2nd of July 2008 EVENT Ingrid Betancourt, and 14 other hostages held by FARC guerrillas, are rescued by the Colombian armed forces. 2nd of July 2010 EVENT The South Kivu tank truck explosion in the Democratic Republic of the Congo kills at least 230 people. 2nd of July 0419 BIRTHDAY Valentinian III, Roman Emperor (d. 455) 2nd of July 1262 BIRTHDAY
